qas.question: Parts of a computer that are not material objects are collectively known as what?
Software stored in hardware that cannot be changed easily is called what?
What type of "ware" is a BIOS ROM in a PC?

context: <a0_0>Software<a0_0/> refers to parts of the computer which do not have a material form, such as programs, data, protocols, etc. When <a2_0>software<a2_0/> is stored in hardware that cannot easily be modified (such as BIOS ROM in an IBM PC compatible), it is sometimes called "<a1_0>firmware<a1_0/>".
